title: Hüseyin Kartal
text:
Hüseyin Kartal (born January 1, 1982 in <a href="E%C4%9Firdir">Eğirdir</a>) is a <a href="Turkish%20people">Turkish</a> professional retired <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>.
Club career.
Kartal has played for <a href="Ankarag%C3%BCc%C3%BC">Ankaragücü</a>, <a href="B%C3%BCy%C3%BCk%C5%9Fehir%20Belediye%20Ankaraspor">Ankaraspor</a> and <a href="Denizlispor">Denizlispor</a> in the Turkish <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a>. He joined in January 2009 to <a href="Kas%C4%B1mpa%C5%9Fa%20S.K.">Kasımpaşa S.K.</a> and left after three and a half year <a href="Diyarbak%C4%B1rspor">Diyarbakırspor</a>.
International career.
Kartal appeared in two matches for the senior <a href="Turkey%20national%20football%20team">Turkey national football team</a>. He made his debut as a last-minute substitute in a <a href="2003%20FIFA%20Confederations%20Cup">2003 FIFA Confederations Cup</a> match against the United States on 19 June 2003. His second appearance, against Cameroon two days later, also lasted only a minute! One of the shortest two-match international careers of all time.
